document.heading: Interest Rate Ceiling Amendment Act of 1983

history.narrative: Law 5-62, the “Interest Rate Ceiling Amendment Act of 1983,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-193, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 15, 1983, and December 6, 1983, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 23, 1983, it was assigned Act No. 5-93 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
